23.description: I don't like GPL but most of the CMS/Blogging software I use is licensed under it so I'm stuck if I want to do any development work I have to release my code under GPL. Automattic/Wordpress.com will not support or advertise any theme or plugin that is not released fully under GPL. That raises questions whether the 'premium theme' creators distributors are in compliance with the license. There is also the crappy attitude and tactic Automattic followed against Chris Pearson... they not only went after the domain that he did have a right to but went after his copyrights and his livelyhood
23.name: GPL and why I won't work developing for Wordpress

24.description: One of the things I see a lot when I read the #eprdctn twitter hashtag (https://twitter.com/hashtag/eprdctn?f=realtime) is how hard it is to build a coherent set of tools to  make the work of creating a valid set of HTML, CSS and Javascript resources without having to push everything to InDesign. 42.description:
Version 2 of Athena Framework. Now that I've learned how to create SPAs with Polymer and now that ServiceWorkers have gained push and notification APIs it's time to revisit Athena and build something closer to what I had in mind when I first envisioned the project.

This version uses GCM as the Push and Notification server and extends the ServiceWorker to act as the GCM client

A tutorial for push and notification is at [http://updates.html5rocks.com/2015/03/push-notificatons-on-the-open-web](http://updates.html5rocks.com/2015/03/push-notificatons-on-the-open-web)
42.name: Athena Framework Version 2
42.notes: Keeping separate repositories to make sure we respect the work people may have done in the original version

43.description: Now that Polymer has hit 1.0 it's time to go back and review web components and answer the following questions: **What** are web components? **Why** use web components? **Why not** use web components? **How** to use web components? **Where** to use web components? **How** to build web components? **Should we use** web components now? We will use three different flavors of web components to answer these questions: Vanilla Webcomponents, X-Tags and Polymer 1.0. The end product will be a rebuild of my athena-framework set of components
43.name: Webcomponents Deep Dive
